title: basket_star
body:
A taxon of brittle stars. They are considered to be of the suborder Euryalina or Euryalida. Many of them have characteristic repeatedly branched arms.

They generally live in deep-sea habitats. However, in Plettenberg Bay, South Africa, they have been observed at 15 meters or less. In the wild, they can live up to 35 years. They can weigh up to 5 kg. Like other echinoderms, basket stars lack blood and achieve gas exchange through a water vascular system. Basket stars are the largest snake-like animals, with Gorgonocephalus stimpsoni having arms up to 70 cm long and a disc diameter of 14 cm.

title: dr._drakken
body:
Dr. Drakken is the main antagonist of the Disney Channel animated series, Kim Possible. He is the arch-nemesis of Kim Possible and the usual employer of Shego. Along with Shego, he reformed in the two-part series finale.

A self-proclaimed mad scientist, Drakken dreamed of world domination, but was constantly thwarted by the efforts of Team Possible.

Drakken was a self-categorized "evil megalomaniac" who was fueled by pettiness and jealousy.

title: yoshida_ken'ichi
body:
Kenichi Yoshida (吉田 健一 [i]Yoshida Ken'ichi[/i], born November 23, 1969 in Kumamoto Prefecture) 

A Japanese artist and animator. He has worked in several anime series and films, as well as videogames and books.

He provided character design for the anime series [[Eureka Seven]] and [[overman king gainer|Overman King Gainer]], and for the videogame [[Arc Rise Fantasia]].

He also made the illustrations for the original release of the novel by Ikegami Eiichi, [[shangri-la|Shangri-La]]. It has been adapted into an anime series, but his original character designs were dropped in favor of new ones made by [[Murata Range]].

Name: 吉田 健一 (Yoshida Ken'ichi)

title: willy_and_joe
body: The popular names for a pair of regular American infantry soldiers who appeared in one panel cartoons drawn by then-Technician 3rd Grade Bill Mauldin while he worked for the newspaper of the 45th Infantry Division and later Stars and Stripes during the latter years of the Second World War in Europe.

title: bill_mauldin
body: William Henry "Bill" Mauldin (1921-2003) was an American veteran of the Second World War, having served with the 45th Infantry Division before his satifical gag comics starring two regular dogfaces, Willie and Joe, earned him the attention of the publishers of Stars and Stripes, with whom he worked for the remainder of the war in the European Theatre of Operations. Post-war, Mauldin continued his work as a cartoonist for various newspapers, becoming quite famous for publishing an image of a grieving Abraham Lincoln at the memorial in Washington DC in the wake of the assassination of President John F. Kennedy in 1963.

title: vegemite
body:
Vegemite is a dark brown food paste originating from Australia that is made from the combination of Yeast extract from brewery yeast, vegetables, and spice additives.

Similar to [[Marmite]] for its distinctive, salty, and powerful savoury flavour, it was created in Australia after World War 1 as a result of a Marmite shortage during the War.

Like Marmite, it also has a reputation for being a "Love it or Hate it" food, since people either love or hate the taste depending on their homeland, be it Australia, other fellow Commonwealth nations, or elsewhere.

Considered a national dish to Australia where it is usually eaten on buttered toast with cheese, vegetables, or meats as an optional topping. In some cases, Vegemite can be used in savoury dishes like soup, stock, pizza, pasta, burgers, casserole, and even ice cream!

title: gn_archer
body:
[b]GNR-101A GN Archer[/b] 
A small fighter craft intended to serve as a support unit for the [[Gundam Arios]]. While it wasn't that powerful by itself - and dependant on the main unit for power, as it would quickly deplete its GN Condensers -, it was still a threat if taken lightly, especially if given the opportunity to dock with the Arios. It was piloted by Marie Parfacy - the true identity of [[Soma Peries]].

title: gundam_arios
body:
[b]GN-007 Arios Gundam[/b]
The successor unit to Kyrios, a transformable MS capable of rapid strikes and devastating bombing. The previous unit's shield was instead incorporated into the main design, enabling the Arios to utilize its deadly pincer attack in flight form. It could also dock with a support unit - the [[GN Archer]] - for enhanced speed and firepower. It was piloted by [[Allelujah Haptism]].

title: cherudim_gundam
body:
[b]GN-006 Cherudim Gundam[/b]
A long range sniping type MS developed by Celestial Being, the successor to Dynames. As with the previous unit, it excelled in precision shooting, but also possessed nine GN Shield Bits for defense and remote attack. It was piloted by [[Lockon Stratos]] - this time, [[Lyle Dylandy]] in relief of his older brother.

title: seraphim_gundam
body:
[b]GN-009 Seraphim Gundam [/b]
The second unit of [[Gundam Seravee]], and the successor to Nadleeh. In the case of an emergency, it would eject itself from the Seravee's large frame, and act as the core unit - rendering the bulky unit as a large attack drone supporting its own agile, high-speed combat. It was equipped with the Trial System as well, allowing it to disable any MS connected to Veda. As with its larger container, it was piloted by [[Tieria Erde]].

title: gundam_seravee
body:
[b]GN-008 Seravee Gundam[/b]
The successor unit to the Virtue, a heavy fire-support "3.5" generation MS. It greatly improved upon the Virtue's mighty firepower while rectifying the bulbous design's close quarters disadvantages by installing hidden sub-arms equipped with beam sabers, as well as enabling it to disperse a GN Field immediately as opposed to using dedicated vents. In addition, whenever needed, it could eject its backpack, which transformed into a different MS of its own - the [[Seraphim Gundam]]. It was piloted by [[Tieria Erde]] as he seeked to defeat the tyrannical A-LAWS.

A character of the [[Kannagi]] spinoff [[Kanpachi]].  She appears as a [[chibi]] version of [[Zange]] with her hair decorated with a coral [[cross]].

Despite her appearance, she is a separate being from Zange, and is a coral (sango in Japanese) deity.  She greatly admires Zange and has decided to copy her appearance and behavior.

title: pachi_(kanpachi)
body:
Title character of the [[Kannagi]] spinoff [[Kanpachi]].  She appears as a [[chibi]] version of [[Nagi_(kannagi)|]] with her hair forming a fish tail and two fins sticking out.  

Despite her appearance, she is a separate being from Nagi, and is a kanpachi (Greater amberjack fish) deity.  She decided to copy Nagi's appearance and behavior after having fallen in love with it when she first saw her.

title: kapool
body:
[b]AMX-109 Capule[/b]
An amphibious mobile suit developed by Haman Karn's Neo Zeon. Its spherical body, which concealed missile launchers and beam cannons, enabled it to cruise in water at high speed, and it packed powerful claws on its extending arms.

Despite not seeing much action during its initial deployment (as Axis's incursion on Earth was repealed by the Gundam Team), remaining Capules were fielded by Zeon remnants as far as [[gundam_unicorn|UC 0096]], and some of those units somehow survived through thousands and thousands of years untouched, eventually being unearthed by future generations [[turn_a_gundam|to fight against the Moonrace]] - those millennia-old machines being nicknamed "Kapool".

title: knight
body:
A member of the [[warrior]] class during the Middle Ages in Europe commonly associated with chivalry and combat. Bred for their skills in horsemanship, swordsmanship and (in a fantasy millieu) magic. However, Danbooru is gracefully unprejudiced. Use this tag when you see a combination of at least three of the following:

* [[sword|Swords]] or [[lance|lances]]
* [[shield|Shields]]
* [[armor|Armor]] 
* [[horse|Horses]] or similar mounts, possibly clad in [[barding]]

If the character belongs to a Knight class from a game, then use this tag at your own discretion. If the character fits all of the above standards but is wearing clearly [[Japanese armor]] and carrying a [[katana]] rather than a European-style sword, use [[Samurai]] instead.

title: gundam_gusion
body:
[b]ASW-G-11 Gundam Gusion[/b]
One of the 72 Gundam Frames produced during the Calamity War. Not much is known about the original form of Gusion, as it was sequestered and extensively modified into a bulbous, defaced appearance while in operation by space pirates. However, once Tekkadan grabbed hold of the unit, it was comprehensively modified into the more Gundam-like [[Gundam Gusion Rebake]], at the instructions of to-be pilot [[Akihiro Altland]].

title: gundam_kimaris
body:
[b]ASW-G-66 Gundam Kimaris[/b]
One of the 72 Gundam Frames produced during the Calamity War. A close combat specialist, Kimaris sported tremendous mobility courtesy of a specialized booster backpack, and the mighty "Gungnir" [[lance]], equipped with two 120mm machine guns, served as the MS's primary weapon. It was passed down as a family heirloom in the Bauduin clan, but when the threat of a Mars group naming themselves "Tekkadan" emerged with a Gundam Frame among their ranks, [[Gaelio Bauduin]] decided to take matters onto his own hands and activated the unit again.

title: gunner_(tera_online)
body:
An offensive class in [[tera online|TERA]]. They carry around large [[arcannon]]s to fire at their enemies, and wear heavy armor in combat.

Gunners are fast-moving and support their allies with heavy artillery. They have small robot companion named [[HB-7 (tera online)|]] that supports them in combat.

title: brawler_(tera_online)
body:
An specialized defensive class in [[tera online|TERA]]. They wear massive powerfists to attack their enemies with.

Brawlers aren't true tanks, but they can still fulfill the role [[lancer_(tera online)|lancers]] do if they time their attacks correctly.

This class is only available to the human, [[elin]] and the [[popori]] races.

title: ninja_(tera_online)
body:
A hit-and-run class in TERA. They hold massive shurikens to attack their enemies at close range, which they may also throw to inflict damage at a distance. Also known as the Assassin(어쌔신) class in the Korean servers.

This class is only available to the [[elin]] race.

title: reaper_(tera_online)
body:
An offensive class in [[tera online|TERA]]. They carry very long chain blades in each hand to attack at close and mid range and wear leather armor in combat.

This class is only available to the [[elin]] race.

title: mystic_(tera_online)
body:
A support class in [[tera online|TERA]]. They hold small scepters to cast their spells, and wear robes in combat.

Mystics support their allies creating medium-sized mending [[orb|motes]] in either red (HP) or blue (MP) colors.

title: berserker_(tera_online)
body:
An offensive class in [[tera online|TERA]]. They wield massive axes and wear heavy armor.

Berserkers deal a lot of damage to their enemies, although their slow attacks are prone to miss. They can endure damage better than most classes can.

title: priest_(tera_online)
body:
A support class in [[tera online|TERA]]. They use long staffs to cast their spells, and wear robes in combat.

Priests use area-of-effect spells to support their allies, primarily by healing them.

title: lancer_(tera_online)
body:
A defensive class in [[tera online|TERA]]. They are equipped with a shield and a long lance to poke their enemies at medium range. Their armor plate allows them to sustain damage better than other classes can.

Lancers are always at the front line, drawing the aggro of enemies and tanking the damage to protect their allies.

title: archer_(tera_online)
body:
An offensive class in [[tera online|TERA]]. They use bows to attack and wear leather armor in combat.

Archers deal damage at a distance with their bows. They stand out from generic archers by using various types of arrows that have different effects, either by exploding or inflicting negative ailments on their enemies.

title: sorcerer_(tera_online)
body:
An offensive class in [[tera online|TERA]]. They channel their will into small discs that orbit around them to cast powerful spells.

Sorcerers are weak on their own, but it more than makes up for the damage they can output in a short time.

title: slayer_(tera_online)
body:
An offensive class in [[tera online|TERA]]. They wield massive greatswords to attack and wear leather armor in combat.

Slayers are specialized in moving quickly across during battle, avoiding damage rather than letting their enemies harm them. Despite holding big swords, they are quick at dealing damage in bursts.

title: warrior_(tera_online)
body: A close-range offensive class in [[tera online|TERA]]. They attack their enemies with their trademark twin swords. Leather armor makes them rather vulnerable to damage.

title: alchemist
body:
The progenitor of the modern [[chemistry|chemist]]. Alchemists are practitioners of alchemy, or the study of an early, unscientific form of chemistry practiced in the Middle Ages with aims including turning base metals into gold and discovering the elixir of perpetual youth, a universal cure for disease, and a universal solvent.

The [[atelier (series)|Atelier]] series of video games is designed around this premise, with the main protagonists being alchemists.

title: sicario
body:
[b]Sicario[/b] ([i]Spanish for Hitman[/i]), is a 2015 action film directed by Denis Villeneuve and starring Emily Blunt, Benicio del Toro, and Josh Brolin.

The plot follows FBI agent Kate Macer(Blunt), who after her team raids a safehouse used by the Mexican Sonora Cartel and discovering the bodies of their victims inside, joins a US Government Joint Task Force composed of Delta Force operators, US Marshals and CIA agents, led by CIA agent Matt Graver(Brolin) and his mysterious assistant Alejandro Gillick(del Toro) to arrest the Cartel leaders for smuggling drugs from Mexico to the US. As the film progress, Kate realizes the Task Force might have a different end goal than they claim, becomes suspicious with Matt and Alejandro's motives and learns the harsh reality on the War on Drugs where the line between good and bad becomes blur. 

The film was well received by critics for it's story, cinematography, acting and action scenes along with the movie's themes on the consequences of America's War on Drugs.

The movie was followed by a 2018 sequel, [b]Sicario: Day of the Soldado[/b], which follows the Joint Task Force led by Matt and Alejandro, as they start a gang war between the Drug Cartels after the US Government suspects the Cartel help smuggled Islamic Terrorists into the US.

title: zee_zulu
body:
[b]AMS-129M Zee Zulu[/b]
An amphibious version of the [[Geara Zulu]] developed by the Sleeves for use by the Zeon Remnants left on Earth. The new units, aside from the modifications for amphibious operation, possessed a set of extendable Heat Claws on each arm and wielded a powerful beam machine gun equipped with a grenade launcher. However, despite being much more advanced than the decades-old models operated by the Remnants, even the Zee Zulu was nowhere near a match for the [[Byalant Custom]], which effortlessly destroyed the two units during the Battle of Torrington.

title: softbox
body:
A soft box is a type of photographic lighting device, one of a number of photographic soft light devices. All the various soft light types create even and diffused [[light]] by directing light through some diffusing material, or by "bouncing" light off a second surface to diffuse the light. The best known form of bouncing source is the umbrella light where the light from the bulb is bounced off the inside of a metalized umbrella to create a soft indirect light.

A soft box is an enclosure around a bulb comprising reflective side and back walls and a diffusing material at the front of the light.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Softbox]

title: super_robot_wars_64
body:
A 1999 [[Super Robot Wars]] game released for [[Nintendo 64]], and the only game released for the console. It was the first SRW game to feature animations in a pseudo-3D space. The game can use the N64's Transfer Pak add-on to unlock extra bonus units by connecting to SRW Link Battler, a [[Game Boy Color]] game.

The game's original characters and [[mecha]] are notably absent from the [[Super Robot wars original generation|Original Generation]] games, likely due to copyright issues arising from it being codeveloped by Monegi, Inc. This would also explain why the original units in [[super robot wars advance|Advance]] have such similar designs as the ones in 64 - to the point that 64's original mecha are mentioned as their predecessors in the OG timeline, despite never actually showing up in the games.

title: maria_la_del_barrio
body:
[i]María la del Barrio[/i] (Spanish for Maria of the Slums) or its international English title, Humble Maria, was a Mexican Telenovela that aired from August 14, 1995 to April 26, 1996 with 92 episodes. The show was the star making role for Mexican actress and singer Thalía.

The show follows María Hernández, played by Thalía, a poor and humble girl who works near a landfill until one day, she is taken in as a ward by Fernando De la Vega, one of the richest man in the country. While being taught to be a proper lady at the De la Vega estate, she meets Fernando's son, Luis Fernando, and the two fall in love. However, María's relationship is opposed by some especially Soraya Montenegro, Luis' cousin, as she wants to inherit the De la Vega fortune by marrying Luis and will do anything to get rid of María.

While one of the world's most popular and successful shows ever, having been broadcast in over 180 countries, the show is also infamous for being over the top even by regular Mexican Telenovela standards. One of the most rememberable meme parts of the show happens later where Luis and María's son, Nando, falls in love with Soraya's stepdaughter, Alicia, and kisses her on the cheek, only for Soraya to catch them in the act and go insane.

body:
An [[eroge]] [[visual novel]] developed by Atelier Kaguya TEAM HEARTBEAT and art by [[M&M]]. The game was released on June 29, 2007.

The main character is Claude. His job is to breed girls to be sex slaves. By following the contract with a [[demon girl|female devil]], [[nora_(toriko_no_hime)|Nora]], he begins to train three heroines, each are [[princess|princesses]]. [spoiler]The game has 5 different endings.[/spoiler]

h4. Characters
* [[eleanor_(toriko_no_hime)|Eleanor]]
* [[lydia_(toriko_no_hime)|Lydia]]
* [[hilda_(toriko_no_hime)|Hilda]]
* [[nora_(toriko_no_hime)|Nora]]
* [[eliot_(toriko_no_hime)|Eliot]]

title: ayukawa_rinka
body:
A character in [[Toriko no Kusari]]. [[yunoki_mio|Mio]]'s best friend and childhood friend, as well as a member of the [[tennis]] club. She is aiming to become a professional tennis player, so she takes her activities at the club very seriously.

Hair: [[blonde_hair|Blonde]] with a [[ponytail]].
Eyes: [[yellow_eyes|Amber]]

title: asahina_konomi
body:
A character in [[Toriko no Kusari]]. She is [[yunoki_mio|Mio]]'s underclassman and the treasurer of the student council, as well as a member of the swimming club. She is the wealthy daughter of the president of a major pharmaceutical company. Prior to entering high school, she'd heard of Mio because her parents were acquaintances with Mio's, but never had interacted with her.

After entering high school, she entered the student council out of curiosity due to Mio being the president. However, she quickly started loving Mio and became dedicated at her job. She was assigned as the treasurer because she's good at maths; however, Konomi has trouble with every other subject. Konomi is also bad at sports but joined the swimming club because she wanted to learn to swim. Her dream is to be able to swim before Mio graduates.

Hair: [[blonde_hair|Blonde]] with a [[ahoge]].
Eyes: [[red_eyes|Red]]

title: toya_shiori
body:
A character in [[Toriko no Kusari]]. She is  [[yunoki_mio|Mio]]'s [[maid]] coming from the Toya family, who have served the Yunoki family for a longer time. She has been with Mio ever since she was young, and the two are like sisters; sometimes they even get mistaken as a pair of siblings. She is willing to do anything for her dear Mio. Despite her relaxed nature, she is proficient in all kinds of household chores.

Hair: [[purple_hair|Purple]] in a [[hime cut]]
Eyes: [[green_eyes|Green]]

title: yunoki_mio
body:
The main protagonist in [[toriko_no_kusari]] who is an active member of the [[tennis]] club, as well as the student council president. Mio is a hardworking girl who is very popular with her peers, and she has a graceful personality.

Her parents are [[doctor|doctors]] and currently working abroad, so she lives together with just [[Toya Shiori|Shiori]], with whom she has a close relationship.

Her cousin is [[ikoma_yui|Yui]].

Hair: [[long_hair|Long]] [[brown_hair|Brown]] and a [[side braid]].
Eyes: [[brown_eyes|Brown]]

title: ikoma_yui
body:
A character in [[Toriko no Kusari]]. She is [[yunoki_mio|Mio]]'s cousin who also lives in her neighborhood and a member of the school's swimming club. She loves the rice [[toya_shiori|Shiori]] cooks, so she often crashes into Yui's house. Similar to Mio, Yui is a very hardworking and diligent person but tends to be overly serious at times too.

She isn't all that sure about her future but wishes to become a coach and PE teacher. During school, she often hangs out with both Mio and [[ayukawa_rinka|Rinka]].

Hair: [[black_hair|Black]]
Eyes: [[orange_eyes|Amber]]

title: troopa_(koopa_fortuna)
body: A small, [[turtle]]-like creature wearing a [[shell casing]] that serves as [[Koopa Fortuna]]'s mascot and visual representation of her fans. Usually green, although they appear in other colors as well.

title: heaven's_door
body:
[[Stand (jojo)|]] power of [[Kishibe Rohan]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. Manifests as a short humanoid with a bowtie and hat.

Its power allows Rohan to view a person's memories as if he were reading a book made from their body. Rohan can write commands in this book, which the target will unconsciously obey. He can also tear out a page, erasing the memories contained on it from the target's mind. He can't use his Stand to read his own "pages", but can use to write commands on them.

Its namesake is the Bob Dylan song "Knockin' on Heaven's Door".

title: yakuchu!
body:
Yaku Chu! is an [[eroge]] developed and published by SCORE, with illustrations by [[Andou Tomoya]]. The game was released in Japan in 2007.

Japanese Title: やくchu!〜ただいま媚薬開発中〜

h4. Game Synopsis
The main character is a 4th-year student at the medical college. But he is also a genius who secretly studies new drugs in the laboratory. It's high time for him to do job hunting, but he misses the best season for it. His acquaintance invites him to a hospital that has the majority of staff left due to the director getting ill. It's only a matter of time until this facility closes down, but it's a perfect opportunity to test different drugs and maybe even a pharmaceutical company as a result.

h4. Characters
* [[Aoba Miwa]]
* [[Aoba Mutsumi]]
* [[Aoba Nanako]]
* [[Aoba Yui]]
* [[Nawashiro Airi]]
* [[Wada Youko]]

title: dungeon_of_regalias
body:
[i]Dungeon of Regaliasan[/i] is an eroge dungeon RPG developed and published by Astronauts/Sirius with illustrations by [[M&M]]. The game released on March 25, 2016.

Japanese Title: ダンジョン_オブ_レガリアス_~背徳の都イシュガリア~

h4. Plot

The floating city of Windal was full of prosperity due to its advanced magic culture. However, an unexplained massive magic explosion sent the city crashing to the ground, killing almost all of its citizens. Only a huge crater and the ruins of the city underneath it remained.

Nomads built many villages and over time, the area turned into the large metropolis Ishgalia. Reckless adventurers came to the city to challenge the demon-infested labyrinths under the city in the hopes of striking it rich. The battle-seasoned Orias, who has no memories before becoming a mercenary, arrived at Ishgalia in search of his forgotten past. What awaits him in the depths of the labyrinth and the ruins of the floating city?

h4. Characters
* [[Claudia Azure]]
* [[Dora Bellmel]]
* [[edna_(dungeon_of_regalias)|Edna]]
* [[Lavinia Casvan]]
* [[Linaris]]
* [[Meriel Steward]]
* [[nemu_(dungeon_of_regalias)|Nemu]]
* [[Tatewaki Shizuku]]
* [[fortuna_(dungeon_of_regalias)|Fortuna]]
* [[ursula_(dungeon_of_regalias)|Ursula]]
* [[Zenobia Giz Mauzes]]

title: zenobia_giz_mauzes
body:
A character from [i][[Dungeon of Regalias]][/i].

h4. Profile
A [[knight]] of the Ishgalia court who serves Demetrio Madram.

Hair: [[very_long_hair|Very Long]] [[grey_hair|Grey]]
Eyes: [[red_eyes|Red]]
Role: Knight
other_names: ゼノビア.ジス.マウゼス

title: meriel_steward
body:
A character in [i][[Dungeon of Regalias]][/i].

h4. Profile
An archaeologist specializing in the lost artifacts of Windal, [[Orias]] and his party are referred to her by [[ursula_(dungeon_of_regalias)|Ursula]] for help in identifying items picked up during [[dungeon]] exploration. She has a truculent disposition but will cooperate with adventuring parties on expeditions to Ishgalia's depths in the hopes of learning more about the lost city.

Hair: [[long_hair|Long]] [[blonde_hair|Blonde]] with a [[ahoge]].
Eyes: [[green_eyes|Green]]
Role: Archeologist
other_names: メリエル・スチュワード

title: ursula_(dungeon_of_regalias)
body:
A character in [i][[Dungeon of Regalias]][/i].

h4. Profile
The owner of the tavern "White Wolf of Darkness" (無明の白狼亭) which is the most popular in Ishgalia amongst adventurers. She rents out rooms, sells food and gives out quests to adventurers. She has a formidable intelligence network and often assists Orias when he is looking for information.

Hair: [[blonde_hair|Blonde]]
Eyes: [[blue_eyes|Blue]]
Role: Inn Manager
other_names: アーシュラ_(ダンジョン_オブ_レガリアス)

title: linaris
body:
A character from [i][[Dungeon of Regalias]][/i].

h4. Profile
Rumors of a girl in white roaming the depths of Ishgalia soon reach the ears of [[Orias]] and his compatriots. When they do save Linaris from a rival adventuring party on a commission to capture and enslave her, they discover she has amnesia and only remembers her name and who Orias is. Linaris resembles someone very closely from the dreams Orias periodically has, so who is she and how is she able to wander the [[dungeon|dungeons]] unharmed?

Hair: [[long_hair|Long]] [[blonde_hair|Blonde]] with a blue flower [[hair_ornament|hair accessory]].
Eyes: [[green_eyes|Green]]

title: nemu_(dungeon_of_regalias)
body:
A character from [i][[Dungeon of Regalias]][/i].

h4. Profile
A skilled half-[[elf]] [[shaman]] who leaves her [[forest]] of Brightleaf Elves to find the source of a global distortion of spirit energy. Her half-elf heritage means the elves who raised her never fully accepted her into their community forcing her to work hard at honing her affinity with the spirits in hopes of fully integrating with her peers.

Shortly after she leaves her forest, she is picked up by the veteran adventurer [[dwarf]] Gilliam and joins his adventuring party to Ishgalia. Gilliam and his fellow adventurers bring Nemu along on their expeditions, but she feels guilty as she trips them up on many occasions.

Nemu shows hostility to [[edna_(dungeon_of_regalias)|Edna]] when in her presence, although the feeling of antipathy is not mutual.

Despite her youthful appearance, she is actually 87 years old but looks younger because of the influence of her long-lived Elven blood. Her ears are also slightly shorter than most elves but longer than those of humans.

Hair: [[long_hair|Long]] [[purple_hair|Purple]] in a [[ponytail]].
Eyes: [[blue_eyes|Blue]]
Role: [[Magician]]

title: edna_(dungeon_of_regalias)
body:
A character from [i][[Dungeon of Regalias]][/i].

h4. Profile

A Brightleaf [[Elf]] [[wizard]] who has left her forest and is in Ishgalia for a specific purpose. She is extremely miserly and will not pass up the chance to earn [[money]] if she can help it. Shortly after meeting [[Claudia Azure]], they form a party together to explore the [[dungeon|dungeons]] below Ishgalia.

Hair: [[long_hair|Long]] [[blue_hair|Blue]]
Eyes: [[yellow_eyes|Yellow]]
Role: [[Magician]]
other_names: エドナ_(ダンジョン_オブ_レガリアス)

title: lavinia_casvan
body:
A character from [i][[Dungeon of Regalias]][/i].

h4. Profile

A [[paladin]] who volunteered for the expedition to recover the holy statue of Lasfarr from the ruins beneath Ishgalia. She is proud of her status but occasionally her actions are contrary to those expected of typical paladins. Although she sometimes gets carried away by the immediate situation, the sense of justice she has is genuine while her benevolent nature makes her popular amongst the poor in Ishgalia's slums and other adventurers.

Hair: [[long_hair|Long]] [[red_hair|Red]] in a [[ponytail]] with [[parted bangs]].
Eyes: [[green_eyes|Green]]
Role: [[Knight]]
other_names: ラヴィニア・キャスバン

title: dora_bellmel
body:
A character from [i][[Dungeon of Regalias]][/i].

h4. Profile

The offspring of renowned [[demon]] summoner Karl Bellmel, she is orphaned as an infant and raised by two demons who serve her both as familiars and as surrogate parents.

Although a skilled summoner with absolute confidence in her abilities, she is more comfortable with the company of demons than with humans. Her greatest wish is to find a way to live in the demon world of Acheron permanently, leaving the world of humans.

Hair: [[long_hair|Long]] [[blonde_hair|Blonde]]
Eyes: [[aqua_eyes|Aqua]]
Role: [[Magician]]

title: fortuna_(dungeon_of_regalias)
body:
A character from [i][[Dungeon of Regalias]][/i].

h4. Profile

The bishop presiding over a small [[church]] dedicated to Lasfarr located near Ishgalia's [[slums]]. Fortuna is highly respected by the slum dwellers for a polite manner and willingness to listen to confessions and problems. All funds from church headquarters are dedicated to improving the lives of the slum dwellers, for this reason, most adventurers do not accept commissions from the church because of the low reward offered.

Hair: [[long_hair|Long]] [[purple_hair|Violet]]
Eyes: [[green_eyes|Green]]
Role: [[Priestess]]
other_names: フォルトゥナ_(ダンジョン_オブ_レガリアス)

other_names: 穂波・高瀬・アンブラー

other_names: アディリシア・レン・メイザース

title: claudia_azure
body:
A character from [i][[Dungeon of Regalias]][/i].

h4. Profile
The sole survivor of the royal family of the kingdom of Azure which was vanquished by its neighbor, Kandona. Claudia was taken prisoner in the battle for the capital and forced to fight in the arena of Ishgalia, only to emerge triumphant in the periodic gladiator tournaments and earn the title of "Champion" which granted her the same rights as a citizen of the city and in so doing allowing her freedom to take on adventurer commissions with [[edna_(dungeon_of_regalias)|Edna]].

Although no longer a [[princess]], Claudia's manner and demeanor have changed little since the fall of Azure and she commands respect from all around her.

She has an immense capacity for alcohol and has no qualms moving around in her gladiator's outfit outside of the arena.

Hair: [[medium_hair|Medium]] [[grey_hair|Grey]]
Eyes: [[blue_eyes|Blue]]
Role: [[Warrior]]
other_names: クラウディア・アズール

title: nora_(toriko_no_hime)
body:
A character from the [[eroge]] [[visual novel]], [[Toriko no Hime]].

A [[demon_girl|succubus]] who appearing before Claude (the main character of the game). She gave him physical freedom when he was initially destined to die. She gives him the magical power of a "tuner" and a tuning house. If Nora doesn't regularly have sexual interaction with Claude, he will lose his magical power, meaning he is destined to be a "tuner" for the rest of his life in order to live.

Nora has [[long_hair|long]] [[purple hair]] and [[yellow eyes]].
other_names: ノーラ_(虜ノ姫~淫魔の調律~)

title: hilda_(toriko_no_hime)
body:
A character from the [[eroge]] [[visual novel]], [[Toriko no Hime]].

Hilda is the [[Princess]] of a religious nation in the northern part of the continent. It is known for its mysterious atmosphere. After the demise of the former king, she was conspired by her brother's plot to aim for the throne and was brought to the "Tuning Hall" as a sex slave.

Hilda has [[black hair]] in a [[hime cut]] with a red [[hair_ornament|hair ornaments]] on each [[sidelocks]], and has [[red eyes]].
other_names: ヒルダ_(虜ノ姫~淫魔の調律~)

title: lydia_(toriko_no_hime)
body:
A character from the [[eroge]] [[visual novel]], [[Toriko no Hime]].

Lydia is the former [[princess]] of a deceased country that lost the war. She is brought to Claude by the [[King]] who attacked her homeland. In exchange for the lives of the King and [[Queen]] from her country, she becomes a sex slave. She is also known as the "White Princess", not only because of her pretty appearance, but also her lively-impatient personality.

Lydia has [[short_hair|short]] [[white hair]] with bangs and [[purple eyes]].
other_names: リディア_(虜ノ姫~淫魔の調律~)

title: eleanor_(toriko_no_hime)
body:
A character from [[eroge]] [[visual novel]], [[Toriko no Hime]].

Eleanor is the first queen of Nimrod, a kingdom built by the long-lived race [[elf|"Methocera"]]. She has [[pointy ears|pointy elf ears]], [[blonde hair]] in a [[high ponytail]] style with [[sidelocks]], and [[aqua eyes]].

title: aka_manto
body:
Any reference to the Red Cloak, a spirit from Japanese urban legend.

A masked spirit wearing a red cloak haunts public bathrooms, asking occupants of stalls a question. Typically, the Red Cloak reaches under the stall and asks if the occupant would like a red item or blue item (such as toilet paper). Choosing either option results in the occupant's death.

"Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aka_Manto]

title: mass_production_huckebein_mk_ii
body: The mass production version of the [[Huckebein MK II]]. It uses a slightly different, more streamlined frame and a different colour scheme; originally tan, and later dull blue. It has the same performance as the prototype, but lacks the advanced technologies, namely the T-Link System, the Gravity Wall and the G-Impact Cannon. It is equipped by default with a Tesla Drive system that allows it to have full flight capabilities.

title: majisuka_gakuen
body:
マジすか学園, lit. [i]"Are you serious?" Academy[/i] is a Japanese midnight drama staring [[AKB48]] members that was aired between January-March 2010 in [[TV Tokyo]]. It's also has a second season which is aired between April-July 2011.

The story takes place at a fictional all-girls school called Majisuka Gakuen where all the students are delinquents. About 3/4 of AKB’s 48 are present in the drama, playing gangster caricatures of themselves. Throughout the show, they use their own names or gangster call signs derived from their real life nicknames. Within the school, the girls are split up into nonsensically themed gangs with different fighting styles.

h4. Characters

title: luca_esposito
body:
A character in [[kanata_no_astra|Kanata no Astra]].

A naturally curious and talented engineer capable of repairing any damage to the Astra. [spoiler]Luca is an adopted child.[/spoiler] His father Marco Esposito is a controversial senator.

[spoiler]Later it turns out that Luca is intersex, having a [[androgynous]] body with sexual characteristics of both sexes. Although he identifies himself as a boy, Luca notes that he doesn't really consider himself a man or a woman, and his identity can change.[/spoiler]

title: isis_(p&d)
body:
[[Puzzles & Dragons]] character.

The representation of the "Egyptian goddess Isis":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Isis. She was illustrated and designed by [[Hino Shinnosuke]]. A woman with very long black hair and blue eyes. In all of her evolutions she wears Egyptian-styled jewelry such as a necklace and a hairband. She also wears a white dress with long, wide, [[detached sleeves]] and is shown wielding a staff.

In her second evolution she gains [[hair tubes]] and her hairband is now winged. She now wears make-up which includes [[blue lips]] and eyeshadow. Her hair now has a blue tint.

In either of her two ultimate evolutions her outfit is even more elaborate and her dress now exposes cleavage.

Isis also is included in the Academy Series where she wears a primary blue school uniform and a red scarf. Her staff is adapted into [[lacrosse stick]] and her hairband is now adapted into a pair of headphones.

h5. PAD Egyptian Series 1

* [b]Isis[/b]

title: gigan_(gundam)
body:
[b]MS-12 Gigan[/b]
A mobile artillery and fortress defense MS developed by Zeon to defend the inner parts of the space fortresses, A Baoa Qu and Solomon. It bore a massive rotary cannon on one arm and a powerful head-mounted cannon on top.

A vastly modified version of the Gigan, sporting a different gatling gun and large additional fuel tanks, was fielded by the Sleeves in [[gundam_unicorn|UC 0096]], over 15 years after its initial deployment.

title: g-line
body:
[b]RX-81 G-Line[/b]
The true form of the mass production version of the 7th Gundam, the G-Line retains the full specifications of its base model while using adaptional mission specific attachments to form a cohesive squad based system. It possessed three base configurations - the high-mobility Light Armor, bulky Assault Armor and balanced Standard Armor - as well as the Full Custom package, which combines aspects of all three.

title: buster_gundam
body:
[b]GAT-X103 Buster Gundam[/b]
One of the five Gundams developed by the Earth Alliance, a heavily armored fire support type equipped with a high-powered 350mm gun-launcher. After being stolen by ZAFT, it was mostly piloted by [[Dearka Elsman]] until he was defeated by [[Kira Yamato]] and the [[Strike Gundam]].

title: gm_ii_semi_striker
body:
[b]RMS-179 GM II Semi-Striker[/b]
A custom-made close combat specialist [[GM II]] built from various spare parts at Torrington Base. Its most notable features (and the origin of its namesake) were the patch-on armor and twin-beam spear taken from a [[GM Striker]]. It fought admirably but was destroyed unceremoniously by the fearsome [[Efreet Schneid]] during the Zeon Remnants' assault on Torrington Base.

body:
[[Mushoku Tensei]] character.

A [[maid]] of the Greyrat household. She was [[Paul Greyrat]]'s classmate in a swordsman dojo. A crippling injury forces her to leave her position as a princess guard, and she becomes a maid to [[Paul Greyrat|Paul]] and [[Zenith Greyrat]]. After working through the revelation with the family, she is taken in as Paul's second wife and becomes closer friends with Zenith.

For PIL's [[eroge]], see [[WAM xxxnovel-wetandmessy.com]].

Wet and Messy, a fetish revolving around gloopy, slimy, or wet substances and cute subjects covered in them.  Bodypaint can be messy, as can certain types of foodplay.

Somewhat rare in Anime/Manga style art, although certain sub-types (paint, nyotaimori) are gaining popularity.

Similar tags in Danbooru are [[nyotaimori]] (human plates), [[wet]], [[slime (substance)|]], [[paint]], [[bodypaint]], etc etc.

title: dazzle_paint
body:
Dazzle camouflage, also known as razzle dazzle or dazzle painting, was a type of ship camouflage used extensively in World War I and to a lesser extent in World War II. It consists of a series of highly contrasting color bands or angular shapes, often black and white, set at irregular angles. The purpose of dazzle camouflage is not to conceal or obscure a target, but to confuse visual spotting and range-finding so it cannot be effectively attacked.

Classic dazzle camouflage notable appears on the turrets of Kantai Collection's [[haruna (kancolle)|Haruna Kai Ni]]. The camouflage used by [[zuikaku (kancolle)|Zuikaku]], [[zuihou (kancolle)|Zuihou]], [[chitose (kancolle)|Chitose]] and [[chiyoda (kancolle)|Chiyoda]] is sometimes called dazzle camouflage, though it's function was different, in that it was intended to disrupt and disguise the ships' flight decks. 

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia entry":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dazzle_camouflage
* Related pixiv tag: "ダズル縞パン":http://www.pixiv.net/search.php?word=%E3%83%80%E3%82%BA%E3%83%AB%E7%B8%9E%E3%83%91%E3%83%B3&s_mode=s_tag_full - the equivalent danbooru search is {{dazzle_paint striped_panties}}

title: unsinkable_sam
body:
[b]Unsinkable Sam[/b] (also known as [b]Oskar[/b] or [b]Oscar[/b]) was the name of an alleged black and white German "ship's cat":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ship%27s_cat whose original owner was unknown. He saw service in both the [[Kriegsmarine]] and [[Royal Navy]] during [[World War II]]. He served on board three vessels and miraculously survived the sinking of all three ([i]Bismarck[/i]'s, then the HMS [i]Cossack[/i]'s, and finally the HMS [i]Ark Royal[/i]'s).

After the sinking of HMS [i]Ark Royal[/i] he retired from his shipborne career and was first transferred to to the offices of the Governor General in Gibraltar as a mouse-catcher. He then was sent back to the United Kingdom where he lived the rest of his life in a seaman's home in Belfast, Northern Ireland until his natural death in 1955.

Some researchers are skeptical whether or not Sam actually existed.

He is often seen in fanart with [[Kantai Collection]]'s [[Bismarck (kancolle)|]]. He also appeared in [[Z1 Leberecht Maass (kancolle)|]]'s holiday damage CG (post #2128215).

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Unsinkable Sam":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unsinkable_Sam

title: amagi_(battlecruiser)_(kancolle)
body:
Tag reserved for Amagi, the nameship of the Amagi-class battlecruisers and sister ship to [[akagi (kancolle)|Akagi]], in the context of [[Kantai Collection]].

Damaged beyond repair in the Great Kanto Earthquake of 1923 while under going carrier conversion and was scrapped as a total constructive loss, she was then replaced for conversion (in accord to the Washington Naval Treaty) by [[kaga (kancolle)|Kaga]], one of [[tosa (kancolle)|two]] ships big enough and far enough in construction to be available for conversion.

Not to be confused with [[amagi (kancolle)|Amagi]], the Unryuu-class Aircraft Carrier.

title: tosa_(kancolle)
body:
Tag reserved for Tosa, the nameship of the Tosa-class battleships and sister ship to [[kaga (kancolle)|Kaga]], in the context of [[Kantai Collection]].

Due to the Washington Naval Treaty, she was left unfinished and her hull was used as a test target before eventually being scuttled. Kaga too was to be scrapped before the Great Kanto Earthquake of 1923 left her as one of the remaining choices for conversion to an aircraft carrier.

title: air_defense_princess
body:
[[Kantai Collection]] [[abyssal ship]] enemy introduced in the Summer 2015 event.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] and [[red eyes]]. She wears a skimpy black outfit, [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]], and a torn headband. Despite being an abyssal destroyer, she has a curvaceous figure that's more in line with that of a battleship shipgirl.

Suspected to be an abyssal [[akizuki (kancolle)|Akizuki]]. It doesn't help either that she is designed by the same artist ([[Shizuma Yoshinori]]), wears a headband, and is a destroyer. Alternatively she could also be an abyssal [[teruzuki (kancolle)|Teruzuki]], who also has the same characteristics, and is the reward for defeating the Princess.

title: shokudaikiri_mitsutada
body:
A [i][[Touken Ranbu]][/i] character.

A [[tachi (weapon)|Tachi]]. His name literally means "Candlestick-cutter Mitsutada", referring to an incident where his namesake was used to kill someone and happened to cut through a bronze candlestick as well. He is obsessed with being cool, even saying it would have been cooler if he had cut through a candlestick made from a sturdier material. He is noted to [[look-alike|resemble]] [[Kantai Collection]]'s [[tenryuu (kancolle)|Tenryuu]] with his [[eyepatch]], general appearance and mannerisms. His black clothes reference the fact that his sword's current appearance is burnt to the hilt.

His original sword is one of  [[Date Masamune]]'s blades, along with [[Ookurikara]], [[Tsurumaru Kuninaga]], and [[Taikogane Sadamune]].  Mitsutada seems to hold the latter in fond regards, since he calls him "Sada-chan" and specifically asked around for him in his citadel quote, leading artists to portray the two in a pseudo-familial relationship. He has nicknames for the rest of Masamune's blades, calling Tsurumaru "Tsuru-san" and Ookurikara "Kara-chan".

He has a generally friendly personality, and is seen as the heart of the Masamune group due to his compassion. When he interacts with [[Sayo Samonji]] or [[Taikogane Sadamune]], he takes on a more brotherly or [[fatherly]] disposition. He also seems to enjoy cooking (a reference to his former master Date Masamune, who also liked to cook), since he's able to actively help out his new masters.  For this reason, some artists portray him as a secondary butler like [[Heshikiri Hasebe]].


Fans have given him the nickname "Candle-Cutter [[Pikachu]]" (CCP), based on an alternate reading of the kanji for Mitsutada.

Appears in [i][[Touken Ranbu: Hanamaru]][/i] as a recurring side character.

Voiced by Satou Takuya. Artist is [[Fuji Mitsuya]].

title: tappi_(kancolle)
body: Tappi (龍飛) was [[houshou (kancolle)|Houshou's]] initial name, after Cape Tappi. Planned as one of six auxiliary ships of the Imperial Japanese Navy's 1918 Eight-Eight Fleet Program, Tappi was designed as a seaplane carrier with flying-off deck. Her design was revised in April 1919 following British WWI combat experience to include a full-length flight deck. She was reclassified as an aircraft carrier with the name Houshou.

title: mii_(yuureidoushi_(yuurei6214))
body:
Character in Yuureidoushi's ''The Reiga Youkai Consultation Agency''.

A bakeneko who originally was a stray cat(?) who drowned herself in the ocean while trying to reach fish being dried on a boat. She was later ressurected by a nekomata who took pity on her. From then on, she wants to take revenge on humanity... if she wasn't already assuaged by her new master, [[Nekomiya Yoshiko]], with fish. Now, she is essentially a sapient cat.

While she is refered to by Yoshiko as "Mii-chan", she refers to herself as "Nyaa".

Suspiciously resembles a certain [[tama (kancolle)|cat-like shipgirl]] (the resemblence was even stronger in her early draft).

title: ne-class_heavy_cruiser
body:
[[Abyssal ship|Abyssal]] heavy cruiser introduced in [[Kantai Collection]]'s Fall 2014 Event based on the Western New Guinea campaign. First shows up as the boss of E-1 stage before appearing as a regular enemy in subsequent stages. Has [[white hair]], wears a [[short dress|short]] [[black dress]] with an [[ascot]] and [[thigh boots]] and a metal piece [[covered mouth|covering her mouth]]. Her armaments are mounted on her thighs and on what appear to be [[tentacles]] growing out of her torso.  

It is noted that she has similarities to [[suzuya (kancolle)|Suzuya]] and [[kumano (kancolle)|Kumano]] in appearance.

title: entombed_air_defense_guardian_princess
body:
Second boss of map E-4 in the Fall 2017 Event in [[Kantai Collection]].

Most likely an [[abyssal ship|abyssal]] version of [[Suzutsuki (kancolle)|]]; the "buried" part of her name, plus the [[chain]]s and [[anchor]]s keeping her immobilized probably refer to Suzutsuki's eventual fate as a breakwater.

Their main distinctive feature is their white cross shaped pupils ([[+ +]]) on black. When damaged, the one turret remaining has black "X" pupils ([[x x]]) on white.

title: bicycle_exercise
body:
One of various exercises where a person's back is on the ground and they move their legs in the air  back and forth as if they were pedaling a [[bicycle]].

h6. Types

* Crunches: Person has their back on the floor, hands behind their head with elbows out to sides, legs make a back and forth stepping motion while person twists their body to have elbow reach toward opposite knee when bending knee up
* Pilates: Person has upper back on the floor, body bent upward and making pedaling motion with the legs upward into the air

title: shiden_kai_2_(kancolle)
body:
紫電改二 "Violet Lightning"

Refers to the [[fairy (kancolle)|fairy]] from [[Kantai Collection]] piloting a Kawanishi N1K3-A Shiden Kai 2, a modification of the N1K3-J Shiden Kai 1 (itself a modified N1K2-J/Ja Shiden Kai, codenamed "George") designed for use on carriers.

The [[n1k|aircraft it was based on]] was considered by both its pilots and opponents to be one of the finest land-based fighters flown by the Japanese during [[World War II|World War II]].

title: saratoga_(warship_girls_r)
body:
[[Warship Girls R]] character. The personification of the USS [i]Saratoga[/i] (CV-3) of the [i]Lexington[/i]-class aircraft carriers.

She looks identical to her sister USS [[Lexington (Warship Girls R)|Lexington]], but with a more childish and playful personality. Many artists depict her as a crazed sis-con.

In her basic form, she has light [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. She wears a white sailor uniform and a [[beret]] with three blue [[feathers]] on the right side.

h4. See also

* [[Saratoga (kancolle)|]]
* [[Saratoga (Azur Lane)]]

title: admiral_arisugawa
body:
A [[fabulous]] [[admiral]] with feminine tendencies far beyond even his own shipgirls. Acts, speaks, and takes care of his body as a woman would. Though his sexuality is stated as being "into guys," it is hinted he holds a special feeling for his secretary ship [[ryuujou (kancolle)|Ryuujou]] who in turn have an unrequited love for him.

Has [[short_hair|short]] [[brown_hair|brown hair]] and relatively built physique. Sports [[nail polish]] on his, at times, [[long fingernails]].  Wears [[earrings]] that match his [[blue eyes]].  Prefers the short sleeved [[naval_uniform|admiral uniform]] in summer while the winter uniform has black gloves.

see post #2087859

title: light_cruiser_oni
body:
[[Kantai Collection]] enemy.

A [[abyssal ship]] introduced in the Winter 2015 event as the boss of the 3rd event map.

She is the composite dark fallen form of [[Naka (kancolle)|Naka]] and [[Agano (kancolle)|Agano]], who were both lost in the Battle of Truk, which the event is based on, and is also the reason she has design elements from both.  The reason for her body being abyssal below the waist is the fact Naka and Destroyer Oite, who tried to save Agano's crew after Agano was torpedoed and sunk, were attacked at Truk and sunk with both being blown in half; all but 20 of Oite's crew were lost and all the surviving Agano crew-members that were saved by Oite were lost as well.

Thus she has been given the nickname "Nakano" (那賀野) by fans.

She is voiced by [[Kayano Ai]] who also voiced [[Katori (kancolle)|]]. Katori, like Naka and Agano, was also lost in the Battle of Truk.

title: seaplane_tender_princess
body:
One of the enemy [[abyssal ship|Abyssal]] ships from [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i], introduced in the Summer 2015 Event.

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[black hair]] and [[glowing eyes|glowing]] [[red eyes]]. Her clothing is all [[gothic lolita]] fashion—a [[torn clothes|torn]], [[lace-trimmed dress|lacy]] [[black dress]], a [[large bow|big]] [[black bow|black]] [[hair bow]], and a [[collar]] with a long [[chain]] attached to it. She has long, black, [[claws|clawed]] [[mechanical arms]], and her lower body is the lower jaw and [[tongue]] of some monstrous mouth with a single large arm sprouting out from behind it.

She is essentially an Abyssal version of [[mizuho (kancolle)|Mizuho]]: they both have the same hairstyle (long, luxuriant, and black), the same lacy clothing, the same role (seaplane tender), and—most telling of all—the same artist ([[Akira (Kadokawa)|]]).

title: destroyer_forest_princess
body:
Boss of E4 of the Rainy Season / Summer 2020 event in [[Kantai Collection]].

Essentially [[matsu (kancolle)|Matsu]] as an [[abyssal ship]].

The "forest" in her name is an abbreviation of "雑木林", a nickname of the Matsu-class destroyers. This is difficult to translate but refers to a diverse forest with many different species of trees, or a "mixed" forest. The Matsu-class were so-called because each was named after a different tree species, and there were many of them (74 were planned and 18 completed, without even counting the Tachibana-class as a subclass).

title: brocon
body:
Siblings (brothers or sisters) acting in extreme fashions towards their brothers.

This would include...

* Acting perverted toward their brother
* Acting in an extremely proud fashion towards their brother
* Siblings known for either of the above acting in collusion with others noted for the same behavior, even across different copyrights
* All of the above would also include sibling-like relationships, even if there is no actual blood relation
** [b]Example:[/b] Any of the ships in [[Kantai Collection]] towards [[little boy admiral (kancolle)|Little Boy Admiral]].

It would not incude...

* Mutual love, i.e. [[incest]] and/or [[yaoi]]/[[hetero]]

h4. See also

* [[Siscon]] (distaff counterpart)
* [[Pervert]]
* [[Female pervert]]

title: armor_girls_project
body:
Armor Girls Project is a brand of figurines of [[mecha_musume|mechanized girls]] by Bandai with licenses to several mecha and mecha musume franchises, including [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i].

In practise, this tag is mostly used for their version of [[haruna (kancolle)|Haruna Kai2]] which features mechanical hands in guise of the armor plating on her rigging. They also have a version of [[kongou (kancolle)|Kongou Kai2]] who can interlock her armor plating to form a shield.

body: The Error Musume are a groups of characters, drawn by [[Kantai Collection]] artist [[Fujikawa]], that are presented on the screen whenever an 'error connection' screen is shown for "various reasons":http://kancolle.wikia.com/wiki/Tutorial:_FAQ#I_keep_getting_an_error_message_with_a_girl_and_a_cat.21. title: uss_intrepid_(cv-11)_(y.ssanoha)
body:
An [[original]] character by artist [[y.ssanoha]], based on [[Essex (Warship Girls R)]]'s design. A [[personification]] of America's Essex-class Aircraft Carrier [b]USS Intrepid (CV-11)[/b].

Like all Essex-class, she wears a black suit with white mini-skirt and red breast plate, carries a black flight deck marked with her hull number, and usually has a flat gaze. However, unlike most of her expressionless sisters, she usually has a smug on her face. She has long straight hair with a giant [[ahoge]]. 

h4. See also

* [[Intrepid (kancolle)|]]

title: kamio_reiji_(yua)
body:
An Admiral featured in [[Yua (checkmate)]]'s [[Kantai Collection]] Doujinshi series: Fleet Journal. 

Originally a Lieutenant (OF-1) from the Imperial Japanese Army, as a commander of the 140th Special Mechanized Infantry Squadron specialized to fight against the [[Abyssal ship|Abyssals]], although to no avail. 

While on verge of death during a battle against a [[To-class Light Cruiser]] in the past, he was saved by [[inazuma (kancolle)|Inazuma]], who was sent into battle for the first time against the Abyssal fleet. 

Afterwards recruited into the Imperial Japanese Navy as a Lieutenant Commander (OF-3) to take command of the Ship Girls. 

Current ranking is Rear-admiral (OF-7).

title: orel_cruise
body:
a.k.a "2-3 All Day Every Day"

In [[kantai_collection|Kantai Collection]], referring to the practice of sending submarine fleet to map 2-3 (Orel Sea) that was very rewarding and low risk for the subs.

Played as a comedy where the submarines (with [[i-58 (kancolle)|I-58]] as the most common victim) are being worked to death repeating the same mission over and over again (thus, 2-3 all day every day)

After KanColle's Phase 2 update, the Orel cruise is considered obsolete due to the map adjustment.

See also post #1692960
other_names: オリョールクルージング

title: submarine_princess
body:
A boss-type submarine enemy in [[Kantai Collection]], introduced in the Fall 2015 event, which focuses on the "Solomon Island Campaign":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Solomon_Islands_campaign].

Like many "princess-tier" [[abyssal ship]], she has voluminous [[very_long_hair|extremely long hair]] and wears a flowing white [[dress]]. To her right is a large metal structure shaped like the bow of a WW2-era submarine, except with a trademark [[teeth|toothy]] maw and glowing eyes.  She holds or swims near multiple [[torpedo]]es. A pair of tubes also seem to connect into the back of her thighs or butt.

Unlike most of the "princess" or "oni" characters, there doesn't seem to be an obvious single historical reference that Submarine Princess represents, instead seeming to embody all submarines. She has, however, been considered "[i]Albacore[/i] Princess" by some, due to the USS [i]Albacore[/i]'s notorious record against the IJN, although [i]Albacore[/i] spent the Solomon Campaign sinking transports, and wouldn't get most of the kills that made the ship notorious until afterwards. There has also been the suggestion that she is "I-27":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_submarine_I-27], an unimplemented Type-B1 submarine (the same class as [[i-19 (kancolle)|Iku/I-19]]) who sank in the area where she is encountered as a boss.

title: hiyoko_(kancolle)
body:
A member of the [[Rashinban Musume]], or compass girls of [[Kantai Collection]].  

Her defining features are her [[brown hair]] in a [[long_hair|long]] [[ponytail]], and the [[chick]] (called a "hiyoko" in Japanese) that sits on her head. She wears a dark gray [[serafuku]] with [[pantyhose]].

She usually has a "[[X3]]" expression and is portrayed as quite hyper.

title: tomonaga_(fairy)
body:
A fairy ace pilot in [[kantai collection]] which represents  Lt. Joichi Tomonaga, [[Hiryuu (kancolle)|Hiryuu's]] air wing commander at the time of Battle of Midway.

She has [[long hair|long]], [[green hair]] and wears a [[hachimaki]].

Originally she pilots the a modified Nakajima B5N and later a Tenzan Model 12.

title: destroyer_princess
body:
E-2 Stage boss of [[Kantai Collection]]'s Fall 2014 Event based on the Western New Guinea campaign.

Essentially [[Harusame (kancolle)|]] as an [[abyssal ship]], referring to how she was the only major Navy casualty of the campaign. Because of being depicted as a dark counterpart to [[Harusame (kancolle)|]], she is nicknamed "Warusame". 

Has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] in a side ponytail, [[purple eyes]], and wears a [[midriff]]-baring two-piece black [[serafuku]] and a spiked [[hat]]. Wields a [[cannon]] on her left wrist. Her rigging takes the form of two creatures with guns and torpedoes on them attached to her thighs. 

Whether she has legs or not, she is most often drawn without them.

Voiced by [[Ozawa Ari]].

title: enemy_lifebuoy_(kancolle)
body:
In [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i], enemy lifebuoys are one of [[Escort Water Princess]]'s four kinds of companions, the ones that make part of her belt(?). They also often appear along with [[gambier bay (kancolle)|Gambier Bay]], being the unabyssalized [[Escort Water Princess]]. Their unexpected popularity essentially turned them into mascots for the Abyssals and the series in general.

They are essentially Abyssal Lifebuoys, with a toric body, short but thin limbs, protruding horns and an expressive mouth. They come in several colors. [[Escort Water Princess]] is featured with white and red varieties, the ones featured in Mizuho's summer art are in her usual chartreuse, and the ones in [[Gambier Bay (kancolle)|]]'s [[Lawson]] art also appear in striped varieties.

title: escort_fortress_(kancolle)
body:
An [[abyssal ship]] from [[Kantai Collection]].  They appear exclusively in events with "Princess"-type bosses.

As a floating orb with a toothy mouth through its center and hazy breath, its appearance is identical to the [[floating fortress (kancolle)|floating fortress]].

They are also not to be confused with the more common [[Enemy Aircraft (kancolle)|]].

title: enemy_aircraft_(kancolle)
body:
The [[abyssal ship|abyssal]] version of [[aircraft]] in [[Kantai Collection]]. Unlike the shipgirl aircraft, which tend to be miniature replicas of real [[World War II]]-era [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] aircraft, abyssal aircraft have the alien appearance of [[abyssal ship]]s.  

They usually look triangular from the top, with a black metal skull-like appearance. Underneath, they have cannons sticking out of their "mouths" or have bombs or [[torpedo]]es strapped underneath. Some, notably those launched by [[Northern Ocean Princess]], have a more [[takoyaki]]-like spherical look, and are white with red highlights.

Not to be confused with the spherical and eyeless [[Floating Fortress (kancolle)|]] or [[Escort Fortress (kancolle)|]].

title: anchorage_princess
body:
An [[abyssal ship]] from [[Kantai Collection]].

Featuring a female humanoid with a large cannon behind her.  She wears her long silvery hair untied and has a pair of wing-like antennae attached to her forehead. She is dressed in a [[black dress]] with a [[showgirl skirt]] attached to a belt at her waist and matching [[elbow gloves]] and boots.  Unlike [[Anchorage Oni]], her dress features a [[navel cutout]] and [[strapless]] top.  Additionally, the belting is adorned by several [[escort fortress (kancolle)|fortress-like orbs]]  which also [[floating fortress (kancolle)|accompany]] her.

body:

As a floating orb with a toothy mouth through its center and hazy breath, it looks identical to [[escort fortress (kancolle)|escort fortress]].

title: 61cm_quadruple_torpedo_mount
body:
"A quadruple tube of heavy-hitting 61cm torpedo. Comes with reloading device to reload torpedoes in quick succession, thus providing more opportunities for pursuance. Fitted on fleet destroyers of post-Shiratsuyu class, as well on modernised heavy cruisers." [1]

The tag applies to the [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i] [[fairy (kancolle)|fairy]]. 

The fairy who maintains this equipment has [[blue hair]] worn in [[short twintails]] secured with [[red ribbon]]s, and wears a [[school swimsuit]] and [[diving mask]]. She occasionally wields a [[trident]].



h4. Links

[1] "Kancolle Equipment Entry":http://kancolle.wikia.com/wiki/61cm_Quad_Torpedo_Mount

title: enemy_naval_mine_(kancolle)
body: The abyssal mine-like thing that is seen in "Z3 Max Schultz's 2016 summer damaged art":[/posts/2458799]. It has tentacles and is seen visibly stripping her in its official appearance. Naturally, the fandom exploded with the implications of such a thing existing in canon.

body: Female Illustrator affiliated in C2 Architecture for [[Kantai Collection]]. Made her debut with [[De Ruyter (kancolle)|]].

title: damage_control_crew_(kancolle)
body:
In [[Kantai Collection]], a Damage Control Crew, or "DameCon" for short, is a type of single-use equipment that prevents a shipgirl from sinking from extreme damage.  

In KanColle itself, they appear as a trio of girls wearing construction [[helmet]]s, work [[jacket]]s, [[pleated skirt]]s, and [[shoes]].  Each one has a different hair style, but they include [[grey_hair]], [[brown hair]], [[low twintails]], [[ahoge]], [[swept bangs]], [[hairclip]] and [[short hair]].  They carry planks of wood, tape, and a [[hammer]].

In fanarts, only a single girl may appear, and there's no guaranteed traits, although the helmet and hammer are common traits.

h4. See also

* [[damage control goddess (kancolle)|Damage Control Goddess]]

title: damage_control_goddess_(kancolle)
body:
In [[Kantai Collection]], the Damage Control Goddess is a special, rare (or paid premium) version of the [[damage control crew (kancolle)|Damage Control Crew]].  In addition to saving a shipgirl from sinking, it fully restores all stats to full upon use, but is still single-use.  

She appears as a [[short_hair|short]] [[brown_hair|brown-haired]], [[solid_oval_eyes|solid-oval-eyed]] [[chibi]] figure with a [[shide]] worn as a [[headband]], and wears a [[happi]] overcoat over her work uniform, which includes an orange [[jacket]] and [[pleated skirt]].  She carries a power [[drill]].

title: the_diamond_arm
body:
A Soviet crime comedy film made by Mosfilm and first released in 1969. The film was directed by director Leonid Gaidai and starred several famous Soviet actors, including Yuri Nikulin, Andrei Mironov, Anatoli Papanov, Nonna Mordyukova and Svetlana Svetlichnaya.
The Diamond Arm has become a Russian cult film and is considered by many Russian contemporaries to be one of the finest comedies of all time. It was also one of the all-time leaders at the Soviet box office with over 76,700,000 theatre admissions in the Soviet era.
The plot of the film was based on a real-life news item about Swiss smugglers who tried to transport jewels in an orthopedic cast.

title: ivan_vasilievich_changes_profession
body:
Soviet science fiction/comedy film directed by Leonid Gaidai and based on the play "Ivan Vasilievich" by Mikhail Bulgakov.
Was one of the most attended movies in the Soviet Union in 1973 with more than 60 million tickets sold.
In the United States has sometimes been sold under the title "Ivan Vasilievich: Back to the Future".

title: chikuma_mask
body:
A [[meme]] made by [[Kantai Collection]] fans.

The character [[chikuma (kancolle)|Chikuma]]'s official art has her hand to her chin as if she were holding a mask  along with an unsettling smile.

Artists make fun of this by making Chikuma actually wear a mask with her supposedly normal face that has unsettling results when removed or using her face as a [[novelty censor]].

title: cha_(kancolle)
body:
A member of the [[Rashinban Musume]], or compass girls of [[Kantai Collection]].  

Her defining features are her [[short_hair|short]] [[brown hair]] with an [[ahoge]], and an [[apple]]-shaped [[hairclip]].  She wears a gray and black [[serafuku]] with white [[pantyhose]].

title: aile_strike_gundam
body:
[b]GAT-X105+AQM/E-X01 Aile Strike Gundam[/b]
The high mobility/atmospheric flight package for the [[Strike Gundam]]. It boasts speed and a versatile beam rifle plus two beam sabers for combat.

title: yonehara_sousuke
body:
An [[original]] character of [[Suetake (Kinrui)]]; a male with short and somewhat spiked dark brown hair inserted into the universe of [[Kantai Collection]] as the commander of Kure Transport Fleet. One-sided infatuation with [[ashigara (kancolle)|Ashigara]] ensued "when her gallantry came through":/posts/1581888 on an escort mission, beginning with post #1581886. 

A master of Kendo who becomes a different person brimming with killing intent when holding something resembling a sword. This fact" gains Ashigara's attention":/posts/1597267 and they "become martial art rivals":/posts/1597269, with a 'loser-follows-the-winner' bet going.

Known as "Maibara" before the proper reading of his name was known.

The only person any Ashigara lover would give her up to.

[spoiler]As of 1st August 2015, he managed to snag Ashigara after a long, seemingly futile, courting, and had a daughter together. .[/spoiler]
[spoiler]As of 11th February 2017, he is the father of two daughters.

title: bauxite
body:
A resource in [[Kantai Collection]]. Bauxite (represented as reddish-brown rocks) is used to resupply [[aircraft_carrier|aircraft carriers]] with planes.

In fanart, bauxite is often treated as a [[food]] eaten by shipgirls. It's one of [[akagi (kancolle)|Akagi]]'s favorite foods in particular.

In real life, bauxite is a form of aluminium ore and the main source of aluminium in the world.

title: kancolle_arcade
body:
An arcade adaptation of the card battle/simulation game [[Kantai Collection]]. Like in the original, you play an [[Admiral (kancolle)|]] who collects and organizes personifications of World War II warships, called ship girls, in order to combat the terror of the seas, the [[abyssal ship|Abyssal Fleet]] 

The difference is that the girls are animated in 3D, you can collect physical cards of the girls (including special edition ones), and the player now can also control their chosen fleet's movement and actions during combat (including choosing when and what to attack with, and which enemy fleet to cross). 

The game charges players with a GP system akin to that of Border Break, where money is converted into GP at a specific rate, with these points consumed for each second of play or converted in exchange for various other game elements. 

h4. External links

* "Official website":http://kancolle-a.sega.jp/

title: obanzai
body: A local traditional Japanese dish from Kyoto. In order to be a obanzai, at least half of the ingredients must be produced or processed in Kyoto. The ingredients for obanzai must also be in season. Obanzai heavily on vegetables and seafood and is easy to prepare. Another feature obanzai is the inclusion of ingredients that are usually discarded as waste.

body: A very popular Japanese food. It consists of Japanese curry wrapped in a piece of dough, then coated with bread crumbs and deep fried. title: hastur_(nyaruko-san)
body:
[b]"The Deity of Wind"[/b]

A character of the series [[Haiyore! Nyaruko-san]]. A being of Hastur, He has the ability to control [[wind]]. He initially came to earth due to some business with his father's organization, but later stayed due to orders to protect [[Yasaka Mahiro]]. He likes Mahiro (Disregarding his own [[otoko_no_ko|gender]]), and makes certain advances to catch [[Yasaka Mahiro|his]] attention (The feeling is not mutual though). As a being of Hastur, he disguises himself with the form of a small boy with [[blonde hair]], [[blue eyes]], a [[braid]], and [[antenna hair]].

title: mallard
body:
Latin: [i]Anas platyrhynchos[/i]
JP: マガモ [i]magamo[/i]

The main ancestor of domestic [[duck]]s, frequently found in parks. 

Male mallards have a glossy bottle-green head separated by a white collar from the purple-tinged brown breast, grey-brown wings, and a pale grey belly. The rear of the male is black, with white-bordered dark tail feathers. The bill of the male is a yellowish-orange tipped with black. Females are streaked brown. Both sexes have a shiny dark blue patch on a portion of the lower wings (speculum feathers).

title: chiyu
body:
A Virtual Net Idol, the first of her genre of fictional characters having their own websites (alongside the parallel phenomena of Jikon websites). Opened on the 14th of February, 2001, the [[chiyu 12-sai|perpetually 12 year old]] VNI would become a hit as the year went on.

Beyond her website, Chiyu would partner up with several entities, and contribute to magazines as well, including the Japanese magazine Netrunner, which would not only create a figure of her, but also have her star in the OVA [[Netrunmon]] (voiced by Momoi Haruko).

Following the rise of [[virtual YouTuber]]s, Chiyu was credited as one of the Pioneers in the field, alongside others such as Ami Yamato (debut 2011), Weatheroid Airi (debut 2012), Sayo-chan (debut 2013), and Infinite Loop's ILtan (あいえるたん).

Chiyu herself would end up debuting as a VTuber on the 14th of February, 2018.

title: tera_online
body:
Short for [b]The Exiled Realm of Arborea[/b], TERA is a South Korean MMORPG by Bluehole Studio. It was released in South Korea on January 25, 2011.

Unlike most MMORPGs it uses a real-time, non-auto-target battle system.

Had a mobile game in China called [i]Elin Expedition[/i] (艾琳传奇). A mobile spin off called [i]Tera M[/i] (테라M) which was followed by a similar mobile entry [[Tera Origin]]. Also a mobile port of the original game as [i]Tera Classic[/i] (테라 클래식).

Infamous for the [[Elin]], an all-female race of prepubescent-looking nature spirits in rather revealing clothes (uncensored version only).

She performs her duties as intended, but has an occasional quirk in her behavior where she acts out violently, as a result of [[Flat Escardos]] having shown her a [[terminator 2: judgment day|"detrimental movie"]] before her training was complete.

title: kidney_stone

title: bladder
body: A hollow, muscular [[organs|organ]] in humans and other vertebrates that stores [[pee|urine]] from the [[kidney]]s before excretion through [[peeing|urination]].

title: kidney
body: One of two reddish-brown, [[beans|bean]]-shaped [[organs]] found in vertebrates. They are located in the left and right retroperitoneal spaces, respectively. They receive [[blood]] from paired renal arteries; blood exits from paired renal [[veins]]. Each kidney is connected to a ureter, which carries excreted [[pee|urine]] to the [[bladder]].

title: white_cane
body:
A type of [[cane]] used by the blind to scan their surroundings for obstacles or orientation marks.  As the name implies, they're typically white in color to stand out and signify the person is blind.  These types of canes are typically not sturdy enough to support the weight of a person as they're intended to be lightly held and waved side-to-side to scan for obstacles.

title: global_defense_initiative
body:
The Global Defense Initiate (GDI) is a faction in the [[Command and Conquer|Command & Conquer]] Tiberium series.  

Formed by the UN as a special task force to deal with significant threats to world peace, they later become the government of humanity (barring the parts under Nod's control) after the spread of the toxic self-replicating substance named Tiberium devastates much of the planet.

Curiously for a "good guy" faction, their military doctrine relies on strong overwhelming force and firepower.

title: sounan_desuka?
body:
A manga about 4 girls (and another set of classmates and the main girl's father) forced to survive when stranded on a deserted island by an airplane crash.  The story has a focus upon the details of survivalism, such as how to find water, prepare shelter, secure food and cook it without any manufactured tools available. 

Its title is officially translated as "Are You Lost?". The original title read literally means "Is that so?", but the "sounan" can also mean "stranded".

h4. Characters

* [[Onishima Homare]]
* [[Amatani Mutsu]]
* [[Suzumori Asuka]]
* [[Kujou Shion]]

h4. External links

* "MyAnimeList: Sounan Desu ka?":[https://myanimelist.net/anime/39456/Sounan_Desu_ka]

title: kujou_shion
body:
A major character in [[Sounan Desuka?]]. Shion is a sheltered girl with the most unrealistic expectations and worst priorities in the girl's survival situation, but with a willingness to take recklessly selfless actions when others are in need.

Shion has [[long hair|long]] dirty-[[blonde hair]] with [[swept bangs]] that have two [[hairclips]], has [[brown eyes]], and medium [[breasts]].

Shion wears a standard [[serafuku]] with a [[white shirt]] with a [[red ribbon]] under a brown [[cardigan]] and [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]], and [[kneehighs]].  She also wears [[frilled panties]] with her name on them and a [[white_bra|white]] [[lace bra]].

title: amatani_mutsu
body:
A major character in [[Sounan Desuka?]]. Mutsu is an honor student that mentally adapts the best to [[Onishima_Homare|Homare]]'s lessons on survival in spite of being the least physically capable.

Mutsu has brownish-[[red hair]] in a short [[bob cut]], wears [[red-framed eyewear|red]] underframe [[glasses]], has [[green eyes]] in a slightly [[tareme]] style, and relatively [[small breasts]].

Mutsu wears a standard [[serafuku]] with a [[white shirt]] with a [[red ribbon]] and [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]], and [[kneehighs]].  She also wears a simple [[white bra]] and [[panties]].

title: onishima_homare
body:
Main character of [[Sounan Desuka?]] Trained by her father as a survivalist, she teaches the other girls what it takes to survive on a deserted island, but thinks on a different wavelength than the girls who only know civilization.  She has no shame about stripping and eating or performing acts the other girls find shocking to survive.

She has [[blonde hair]] in medium-length [[pigtails]], [[blue eyes]] in [[tsurime]] style, and has medium-sized breasts.

Homare wears a standard [[serafuku]] with a [[white shirt]] with a [[red ribbon]] and [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]], and [[kneehighs]].  She also wears a simple [[white bra]] and [[panties]].

title: nightingale_pledge_(fate)
body:
[[florence nightingale (fate)|Florence Nightingale]]'s Noble Phantasm in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. It depicts a large, ghostly woman wearing a nurse's uniform, who slams her sword upon the enemy. It doesn't cause damage, but debuffs the enemy while healing the party.

The actual Nightingale Pledge is a modified version of the Hippocratic Oath dedicated to nurses.

title: edward_teach
body:
[b]Blackbeard[/b] (c. 1680 – 22 November 1718), otherwise known as [b]Edward Teach[/b] or [b]Edward Thatch[/b], was an infamous [[pirate]] who operated around the West Indies and the eastern coast of the American colonies. His ship was known as ''Queen Anne's Revenge'', and was outfitted with forty guns. He and his crew terrorized the West Indies and the Americas for three years before finally being taken down near Ocracoke, North Carolina by a small force of sailors led by British Royal Navy Lieutenant Robert Maynard.

h4.Other character tags based on him

* [[edward teach (fate)|Edward Teach]] ([[Fate/Grand Order]])
* [[edward_teach_(eiyuu_senki)|Edward Teach]] ([[Eiyuu Senki]])

h4.External Link

title: mitsumame
body:
A Japanese dessert, consisting of small cubes of agar [[gelatin]], a white translucent jelly made from red algae or seaweed. The agar is dissolved with water or fruit juice to make the jelly. It is served in a bowl with boiled azuki beans, often gyūhi, Shiratama dango and a variety of fruits such as peach slices, mikan, pieces of pineapples, and cherries. The mitsumame usually comes with a small pot of sweet black syrup, or kuromitsu, which one pours onto the jelly before eating.

body:
A manga series of the Toaru franchise and the tenth manga series based off of [[Toaru Majutsu no Index]]. An original side story written by [[Kamachi Kazuma]] and illustrated by [[Kisaragi Nankyoku]], it focuses on the past of [[Kakine Teitoku]].

Its full title is Toaru Kagaku no Dark Matter (とある科学の未元物質, lit. "A Certain Scientific Dark Matter"), formally known as Toaru Majutsu no Index Gaiden: Toaru Kagaku no Dark Matter (とある魔術の禁書目録外伝 とある科学の未元物質, lit. "A Certain Magical Index Side Story: A Certain Scientific Dark Matter").

h4. External Links

* "Toaru Majutsu no Index Wiki: Toaru Kagaku no Dark Matter (manga)":[https://toarumajutsunoindex.fandom.com/wiki/Toaru_Kagaku_no_Dark_Matter_(manga)]

title: toaru_hikuushi_e_no_koiuta
body:
とある飛空士への恋歌, lit. [i]Love Song for a Certain Pilot[/i] is a Japanese light novel series by Inumura Koroku and illustrated by [[Morisawa Haruyuki]]. It is set in the same fictional universe as Inumura's earlier light novel [[Toaru Hikuushi e no Tsuioku]].

Five volumes were published between 2009 and 2011 by Shogakukan under their Gagaga Bunko imprint.

An anime television series by TMS Entertainment aired in Japan between January 6 and March 31, 2014. The series was licensed in English by NIS America under the title "The Pilot's Love Song".
