title: yuzuriha_ringo
body:
A character introduced in [[Toaru Kagaku no Dark Matter]].

Yuzuriha seems to possess a very cold, melancholic and quiet disposition as seen where she nonchalantly ignored a group of delinquent thugs threatening her and attempting to kidnap and sell her to a research facility and when [[Kakine Teitoku]] bursted in and brutalized the thugs, Yuzuriha again did not displayed any strong emotion to his brutality and instead agreed to come with him without question despite the obvious suspicious circumstances surrounding the situation.

She has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] styled in a [[bob cut]] with [[bangs]], [[black eyes]], and typically wears a [[pink dress|pink]] [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[sundress|sun]][[dress]] with black [[spaghetti straps]] under a [[green coat|green]] [[coat]] (often [[open coat|open]] and [[off shoulder|off her shoulders]]) and [[white footwear|white]] [[boots]].  Her face is usually depicted as [[expressionless]].

title: chika_chika_idol

title: misaka_imouto_10032's_cat
body:
[[Misaka imouto 10032]] from [[Toaru Kagaku no Railgun]]'s adopted stray [[black cat]].

Often called "Dog" by the fan community, its lack of a firm name is actually a bit of a running joke. Misaka 10032 first names it "dog" as a joke, then "Tokugawa Ieyasu", and "Schrödinger". [[Kamijou Touma]] doesn't agree to any of these as a good name for a cat. She then agrees to put the matter of naming the cat on hold, and it's thought she might have literally named it "保留" or "on hold" at that point. The cat is often seen with Misaka 10032 and is occasionally important to the plot of the series.

h4. External links

* "Toaru Majutsu no Index Wiki: Misaka 10032's cat":[https://toarumajutsunoindex.fandom.com/wiki/Misaka_10032%27s_Cat]
* "Japanese Wikipedia: 妹達: 御坂妹 / 10032":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%A6%B9%E9%81%94#%E5%BE%A1%E5%9D%82%E5%A6%B9_/_10032%E5%8F%B7]

title: tsukuyomi_komoe
body:
[[Toaru Majutsu no Index]] character.

Despite her [[loli]]-like body, Tsukuyomi Komoe may have more in common with [[Kogami Akira]] than [[Caro ru Lushe]]: she smokes, pounds beers like [[Katsuragi Misato]], and may give the slovenly [[Noda Megumi]] a run for her money with her messy apartment. Despite this, she is an accomplished high school educator and [[Kamijou Touma]]'s homeroom teacher. Moreover, she's well learned in psychology and psychiatry, and (though she has no ability herself) is interested in [[fire|pyrokinesis]].

title: kumokawa_seria

title: gulliver's_travels
body:
A satire written in 1726 by Johnathan Swift. The titular character visits several fictional and fantastical nations. Considered a classic of English literature.

The most notable chapter involves Gulliver being held captive and tied down by a race of 6-inch tall people.

title: toaru_kagaku_no_accelerator
body:
The fifth manga series in the [[Toaru Majutsu no Index]] franchise. Its full title is [b]Toaru Majutsu no Index Gaiden: Toaru Kagaku no Accelerator[/b] (とある魔術の禁書目録外伝 とある科学の一方通行, lit. "A Certain Magical Index Side Story: A Certain Scientific Accelerator").

Carrying the "Scientific" title of the series, it is like [[Toaru Kagaku no Railgun]] as unlike the [[Toaru Majutsu no Index]] Manga, which is an adaptation of the light novels, the Toaru Kagaku no Accelerator manga is an original side story written by Kamachi Kazuma himself. Artwork is done by Yamaji Arata and was serialized on December 27, 2013 in Monthly Comic [[Dengeki Daioh]] with its sister-series [[Toaru Kagaku no Railgun]].

h4. External links

* "Toaru Majutsu no Index Wiki: Toaru Kagaku no Accellerator (manga)":[https://toarumajutsunoindex.fandom.com/wiki/Toaru_Kagaku_no_Accelerator_(manga)]

title: velvet_room
body:
A mysterious location central to the plot of the [[Persona]] series, where the protagonists are given the ability to change their Personas.

The room is always decorated lavishly in blue velvet and is hosted by a mysterious, long-nosed man named [[Igor (persona)|]].  It exists "between dream and reality, mind and matter."  It and its entranceway are invisible to those without sufficient spiritual power or, in later games, to those not chosen by it.

In the first two games, it is a static room.  In [[Persona 3]], it is an endless ascending elevator, in [[Persona 4]], it is a limousine traveling through a luminous fog and in [[Persona 5]] it takes the form of a prison.

h4. See also

* [[Nameless (Persona)|Nameless]] - The piano player, in [[Persona 1]] & [[Persona 2]]
* [[Belladonna (Persona)|Belladonna]] - The singer, in [[Persona 1]] & [[Persona 2]]
* [[Demon Artist]] - The painter, in [[Persona 2]] only
* [[Elizabeth (Persona)|Elizabeth]] - [[Persona 3]] series

title: koha-ace
body:

It stars [[Kohaku (tsukihime)|]] from [[Tsukihime]] and features characters from various Type-Moon series. It is drawn in a [[chibi]] style, and it is a self-aware series that constantly breaks the [[fourth wall]].

[[Carnival Phantasm]] included segments based on the series, and it was the focus of Type-Moon's 2012 April Fools' Day joke. Several characters from Koha-Ace have been made into Servants in [[Fate/Grand Order]].

title: open_in_internet_explorer
body:
Old browsers such as [[Internet Explorer]] 8 and earlier had a unique quirk on how they rendered images when they're highlighted. Artists at the time took advantage of that and added "subliminal" images in their art as a bonus for those that use such browsers.

h6. Explanation of how it works

The trick works because those legacy versions of Internet Explorer highlight images using a non-transparent grid pattern, which cancels out one of the two images that have been interleaved into one image using the grid pattern. It dosn't work in modern browsers because they tint images, rather than using the grid method.

Basically, the grid method works like this. Two images are put together like so:

121212121
212121212
121212121
212121212

When highlighted, the "1" image is masked by the highlight, thus this is the result:

#2#2#2#2#
2#2#2#2#2
#2#2#2#2#
2#2#2#2#2
#2#2#2#2#

and the second image can then be plainly seen.

h6. Viewing hidden images without legacy versions of Internet Explorer

Here is a method of revealing the hidden image using a layer-based image editor like Photoshop or GIMP:

* Open the image.
* Create a new black or white layer above the original image. On this new layer, attach a [i]layer mask[/i].
* Render a 1-pixel black and white checkerboard pattern as the layer mask. This effectively creates an opaque solid color layer where every other pixel is transparent.
* Nudge the checkerboard layer one pixel at a time to switch between images.

Consult the documentation or Google instructions on how to use layer masks and render checkerboards in your image editor.

title: keyarga_(kaiyari)
body:
The male protagonist of the series [[Kaifuku Jutsushi no Yarinaoshi ~Sokushi Mahou to Skill Copy no Chouetsu Heal~]].  The Hero of Recovery, Keyarga's real name is Keyaru, but took on an alias after becoming a wanted man by the Gioral Kingdom.  He has [[brown hair]] and [[brown eyes|eyes]], and possesses magic sight in his right eye that [[glowing eye|glows]] green when in use.  He seeks the destruction of the Gioral Kingdom and revenge against Gioral's Hero Party members who raped, abused, and used him in the timeline before he rewound time.

His name and aliases are derived from the naming of healing spells from [[Final Fantasy]].  Cure (Kearu) -> Keyaru, Curaga (Kearuga) -> Keyarga, Cura (Kearura) -> Keyarura.
